intro: Bergeranthus carinans, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Bergeranthus carinans is considered a delicate and specialized species.
